node.text:
Still life with coconuts. Francisco Oller 1893. Brooklyn Museum, New York.
This 'pachadi' - the South Indian version of 'raita' - is made with a mixture of diced pineapple, turmeric, green chillies, grated coconut, garlic, ground cumin, toasted mustard seeds, curry leaves and yoghurt. It is usually served with sambhar (a lentil and vegetable stew) and rice on the side.
Place 250grams (1 cup) pineapple, that has been peeled, cored and cut into 5mm (1/4 in) dice, about 150ml water (2 /3 cup) and 1/8 teaspoon ground turmeric in a saucepan and bring to a boil, then cook over a gentle heat until tender, adding a little more water if necessary.
Meanwhile place 25 grams (1/4 cup) freshly grated coconut in a mortar with 1 or 2 cored and de-seeded green chillies, 1 or 2 crushed garlic cloves and 1/4 teaspoon  ground cumin,  grind with a pestle, then add just enough water to form a smooth paste.Add to the pineapple, mix well, and season  with salt and black pepper. Simmer for a few more minutes to blend the flavours. Set aside to cool completely, then stir in 250ml (1 cup) yoghurt.
Heat 1 teaspoon coconut oil in a small frying pan and add 1/2 teaspoon mustards seeds and 2 or 3 curry leaves. Cook over a moderate heat for about 1 minute or until the mustard seeds start to sputter, then add to the pineapple mixture. Will keep for 2 to 3 days in the refrigerator. 
Serve 4 to 6
#pachadi #raita #kerala #indianfood #pineapple #pineapples #coconut #coconutoil #yoghurt #southindianfood  #spices #exoticfruit #franciscooller  #artist #brooklynmuseum #art #exoticfruits #museum #easyrecipes #tasty #artgallery #artandfood #stilllifepainting #stillife #stilllife #homecook #eatrealfood  #eattheworld #southindianrecipes #indianrecipes.

Still life with avocado and utensils. Francisco Oller. c. 1890-91.  Museum of Art of Puerto Rico.
This delicious avocado hummus is flavoured with lime juice and chilli and garnished with lightly toasted pumpkin seeds and paprika.  @thegfw
Cut I large ripe avocado in half and remove the stone. Scoop out the flesh and place in a blender or food processor with 250grams (1  1/2 cups) cooked and drained chickpeas, 3 or 4 tablespoons lime juice, 3 tablespoons dark tahini, 1 or 2 crushed garlic cloves, 1/2 jalapeño chilli that has been de-seeded and finely chopped and a few tablespoons of the cooking or filtered water. Process until smooth and creamy, adding a little more cooking water if necessary. Season with salt and black pepper. Transfer to a serving dish and drizzle with 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil. Sprinkle with paprika and garnish with 2 tablespoons lightly toasted pumpkin seeds. Serve with vegetable crudités or lightly toasted pita bread on the side. Serves 4 to 6.
#veganrecipes #vegan #veganfood #avocado #avocadolover #middleasternfood #eatrealfood #vgang #eatforhealth #youarewhatyoueat #vegetarianrecipes #chickpeas #fitfood #pumpkinseeds #chilli #easyrecipes #veganeatsplease #veganeats #vegansofig #eatwholefoods #plantpowered #plantbased #letscookvegan #mezze #israelifood  #stilllifepainting #art #franciscooller #easyfood #museumofartofpuertorico

Plums on the edge of the table. Constantin Daniel Stahi. 1905.
This recipe for stuffed potato gnocchi comes from Friuli in north east Italy. Traditionally they are made between the end of August and October when small black plums are in season, but they are also very good made with partially hydrated prunes. Although they are sweet, they are usually served as a 'primi' or first course, rather than a dessert.
Cook 1 kilo (2 lbs) potatoes in plenty of lightly salted boiling water for 25 minutes or until tender. Drain well and peel when they are cool enough to handle. Transfer to a mixing bowl and mash with a potato ricer. Add 1 egg yolk and 1/2 teaspoon salt and just enough unbleached white flour (about 250g/ 2 cups) to hold the mixture together. Shape into 12 to 15 balls about the size of an egg, then flatten each ball between your hands to form a disk. Place a partially hydrated pitted prime in the centre of each disk, then enclose it with the dough, taking care that the prune is completely sealed.
Melt 4 tablespoons butter in a frying pan and when it is hot add 4 tablespoons breadcrumbs. Cook, stirring constantly, until they turn golden.
Meanwhile cook the gnocchi in batches in plenty of lightly salted boiling water. They will float to the surface when they are cooked. Remove with a slotted spoon and transfer to a heated serving dish. Pour over the melted butter and breadcrumbs and sprinkle with 1 or 2 tablespoons sugar and 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon . Serve hot. Serves 4
#gnocchi #dumplings #prunes #friuli #primi #italianfood #meatfreemonday #meatless #vegetarianrecipes #iloveitalianfood #italiancooking #eayrecipes #stilllife #stilllifepainting #art #stillife #museum #gallery #artist #potato #potatos #potatoes #vegetarian #eattheworld #homecooking #cookitalian #recipes #italianfoodie #instafood #recipe

Still life with vegetables Hans Thoma. 1873. Stadel Museum, Frankfurt-am-Maine. 
These little carrot and potato croquettes make a delicious lunch with a green salad on the side. Instead of dipping them in flour, egg white and breadcrumbs, you can, if you prefer, simply roll them in breadcrumbs, then drizzle them with a little olive oil and bake them in the oven.
Bring 450g (1 lb) diced carrots and 450g (1 lb) peeled and diced potatoes to boil in plenty of lightly salted boiling water until tender. Drain well, then mash with a potato ricer. Add 2 egg yolks, 25 grams (1/4 cup) freshly grated grams padana or parmesan cheese and 2 or 3 tablespoons dry breadcrumbs and blend well. Season with a grating of nutmeg, salt and black pepper. Shape into balls about the size of a walnut , then flatten them slightly. Dip in flour, then lightly beat egg white, then roll in breadcrumbs. Deep fry in hot olive oil until they are golden on both sides. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on a paper towel. Serve hot. Serves 4. #carrots #potatoes #croquettes #fritters #crocchette #italianfood #veggies #veg #potato #potatos #lunch #supper #foodgasm #instafood #vegetarianrecipes #artist #vegetarian #stillife #art #artgallery #museum #stilllifepainting #stilllife #homecooked #veggielove #easyrecipes #foodart #artandfood #foodandart #italianrecipes

Still life with walnuts, almonds, partly peeled lemon, olives in a jar and a glass of wine. Miguel Parra Abril. 19th century. 
Celery caponata or Christmas caponata (caponata di natale) is one of the most delicious ways I know of preparing celery. It consists of celery sautéed in olive oil with chopped almonds, sultanas, green olives, capers, wine vinegar and sugar. The word 'caponata' is thought to derive from 'capon' or 'cappone' - a kind of vegetable cracker made with oil and vinegar that sailors used to eat on board ship instead of bread. Recipe from my book: Mediterranean Vegetarian Cooking. 
Trim the ends of 6 celery stalks and slice them thinly. Heat 2
tablespoons extra virgin olive oil in a large frying pan and add the celery. Cover and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes or until the celery is tender. Add 50 grams (1/3cup) toasted blanched almonds that have been finely chopped, together with 50grams (1/3 cup) sultanas, 50 grams (1/3 cup) pitted and chopped green olives and 2 tablespoons well-rinsed salted capers. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Add 3 tablespoons wine vinegar and 1 tablespoon sugar and cook, uncovered, for a further 5 minutes or until the flavours are blended and the vinegar is evaporated. Serve at room temperature. Serves 4.  @thegfw 
#celery #sicilianfood #caponata #caponatasiciliana #sicilyinfood
#antipasti #antipasto #vegan #veganrecipes #letscookvegan #cucinasiciliana #veggies #plantbased #instavegan #easyvegan #eatplants #veganinspo #letscookvegan #plantbasedrecipes #veganiseasy #stilllife #vegansofinstgram #cataniafood #italianfoodlover #cookitalian #eatreal #vegansofig #cibobuono #sicilyfoodporn #plantpower #vegetarianrecipes

Still Life of fruit and vegetables. Detail. Georg Flegel 17th century.
This Levantine dish has a wonderful mix of flavours and textures. It is made with red cabbage simmered in olive oil with onions, apples, a little sugar, lime juice, cardamom, allspice, cloves and pomegranate molasses and garnished with toasted hazelnuts.
Trim the end of 1 small red cabbage (about 1 kilo/2lbs), cut into quarters and remove the stalk. Shred coarsely.
Heat 3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil in a heavy saucepan and add 1 medium finely chopped red onion. Cook over a moderate heat until it is softened. Add the cabbage and 2 peeled, cored and diced, tart apples and stir well. Cover and simmer for 45 to 50 minutes or until very soft, stirring from time to time so it  cooks evenly. Mix 1 or 2 tablespoons pomegranate molasses with the juice of 1 lime and stir into the mixture. Add  1 or 2 tablespoons sugar, 1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon allspice and 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves and stir well. Season with salt and black pepper. Simmer for a further 5 minutes to blend the flavours. Serve hot garnished with 3 tablespoons chopped hazelnuts.  Serves 4. @thegfw
#cabbage #redcabbage #redonions #apples #vegan #veganrecipes #plantbased #cardamom #levantine #arabiccuisine #georgflegel #arabicfood #plantpower #middleeasternfood #mezze #mediterraneandiet #mediterraneanfood  #pomegranatemolasses #mediterraneandiet #museum #eatmoreplants #eatrealfood #stilllife #stilllifepainting #art

Still life with fruit and mushrooms. Eloise Harriet Stannard. 19th century.
MUSHROOMS: The Art, Design and Future of Fungi - curated by Francesca Gavin @roughversion
is showing at @somersethouse until ‬26 April. Admission Free.
Mushroom strudel makes a very good snack, light lunch or supper dish. You can use cultivated or wild mushrooms -whatever is at hand. Recipe from my latest book: Hazana: Jewish Vegetarian Cooking.
To make the filling, heat 3 tablespoons butter or olive oil in a heavy frying pan and add 2 or 3 finely chopped shallots. Cook over a moderate heat until they are softened. Add 450g (1 lb) thinly sliced mushrooms and a handful of finely chopped flat leaf parsley and cook for 5 minutes or until they are tender. Pour in 1 or 2 tablespoons dry white wine, sherry or port, raise the heat and cook until the liquid is evaporated. Stir in 2 teaspoons flour and simmer for 1 or 2 minutes without browning. Remove from the heat. Stir in 2 tablespoons smetana or sour cream and 1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh chives and season with salt and black pepper
Lay a large sheet fresh or thawed filo pastry on a clean cloth and brush lightly with melted butter or olive oil. Place another sheet of filo pastry on top and brush with butter, repeat with another sheet of filo pastry. Spoon the mushroom mixture over the third of the pastry nearest to you. Fold over the edges to seal in the filling. Carefully pick up the corners of the cloth and roll the strudel over once. Brush the top with melted butter. Lift up the cloth again and roll the strudel over completely. Brush the top with melted butter. Pick up the cloth-wrapped strudel, then carefully ease the strudel out of the cloth onto a well-greased baking sheet. Brush the top lightly with butter and sprinkle with 2 tablespoon poppy seeds. Bake in a preheated 180C/350F oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until the to is golden. Serve hot with smetana or sour cream on the side. Serves 4
#strudel #mushroom #mushrooms #fungi #jewishfood #jewish #jewishcuisine #art #hungariancuisine #artist #hungarianfood #lunch #vegetarianfood #supper #vegetarian #easyrecipes
#theartofmushrooms #snacks #snack  #foodandart #artandfood

Grapes and plums on a plate, with pears and a glass bottle on a ledge. Luis Melendez. 18th century. Private Collection.
This recipe is a variation of a classic Piedmontese dessert. It consists of baked pears stuffed with a mixture of crushed amaretti, sugar, cocoa, egg yolk and a little amaretto liqueur.
Peel and core 4 firm, ripe pears and cut them in half lengthwise.
Place 60g (2oz) crushed amaretti in a bowl with 2 tablespoons sugar and 2 tablespoons unsweetened dark cocoa powder. Add 1 egg yolk and about 1 tablespoon amaretto or rum and mix well.
Spoon the mixture into the pear halves and dot with butter. Arrange the pear halves side by side in the bottom of a lightly buttered baking dish and pour in 4 tablespoons amaretto. Bake in a preheated 180C/350F oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until the pears are tender and the tops are golden. Serve hot. Serves 4. @thegfw
#dolci #piedmont #cucinapiemontese #fruitlover #amaretti #dessert #dessertsofinstgram #art #desserts #sweets #artist #sweetooth #sweettooth #stillife #stilllife #museum #stilllifepainting #dessertlover #artandfood #foodandart #foodinspiration #easyrecipes #thegfw #masterpiece #treat #fruit #foodgasm  #yummyrecipes #dessertporn #cocoa

Fruit and flowers. Balthasar van der Ast. 
c. 1620. Rijksmuseum, Amsterdam.
Seedless grapes make a lovely addition to this simple cake made with eggs, sugar, flour, milk, sunflower seed oil and rose water. It's very good for breakfast with a cup of coffee or for teatime.
Beat 2 eggs with 100g (1/2 cup) sugar until light and fluffy. Stir in 75ml (1/3 cup) sunflower seed oil and 1 tablespoon rose water and blend well. Add 150 g (1  1/4 cups) wholemeal  flour or unbleached white flour mixed with 1 teaspoon baking powder, alternately with 75ml (1/3 cup) milk to make a smooth batter. Lastly fold in 200g (7oz) seedless black grapes, stems removed. Pour into a well-buttered 22/23 cm (9/10in) springform cake tin that has been dusted with flour and bake in a preheated 180C/350F oven for 45 to 50 minutes or until a knife comes out clean from the centre. Remove from the oven and set aside for 5 minutes. Unclip the pan and leave to cool completely. Dust with icing sugar and serve. Serves 6 to 8.
#grapes #grape #fruit #freshfruit #teatime #breakfast #fruitlover #dolci #dutchpainting #stilllifepainting #stillife #stilllife #rijksmuseum #easyrecipes #fruitcake #fruitcakes #homebaking #cakelover #homebaked #foodinspiration #artist #artandfood #foodandart #masterpiece #museum #sweettooth #sweetooth #desserts #sweet #art

The afternoon meal. Luis Melendez. c. 1772. Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York.
This light bread pudding from the Valle d'Aosta  is made with rye bread, ground almonds, chocolate and spices.
Grate 60 grams (2 oz) stale rye breadcrumbs and set aside.
Beat 4 tablespoons butter with 50 grams (1/3 cup) sugar until light and fluffy. Add 3 egg yolks, one at a time and mix well. Add the breadcrumbs, 50 grams (1/3 cup) ground almonds, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves and the finely grated rind of 1/2 organic lemon and blend well. Stir in 40 grams (1/3 cup) finely grated dark chocolate. Lastly fold in 3 stiffly beaten egg whites. Pour into a well-buttered baking dish that has been dusted with flour and bake in a preheated 180C/350F oven for 40 to 45 minutes or until the pudding is puffed and a knife comes out clean from the centre. Serve hot.  Serves 4.
#breadpudding #bread #madefromscratch #timefortea #teatime #chocolatepudding #dessert #sweettooth #sweetooth #desserts #dessertporn #pudding #instadessert #museum #dessertporn #artist #luismelendez #stillife #dessertsofinstagram #stilllife #stilllifepainting #dessertlove #museum #dessertgram #instadessert #sweetreats #masterpiece #metroplitanmuseumofart #sweets #dolci

Still life with vegetables. Henri Horace Roland de la Porte . 18th century. Musee de Beaux Arts, Rouen.
So exciting. MUSHROOMS, the Art , Design and Future of Fungi opens at Somerset House tomorrow. Curated by Francesca Gavin @roughversion  Admission Free.  So much to discover - without fungi, plants may never have colonised planet earth ! @thegfw @seanagavin 
#somersethouse #funghi # fungi #mushrooms #mycelium #mushroom #wildmushrooms #theartofmushrooms #thegourmand

Still life with cabbage and guinea pig. Jacob Samuel Beck. 18th century.
I love all kinds of strudels - they are delicious and so easy to prepare. This one from Croatia - called 'savijaca s kupusum' -makes a delicious snack. It is filled with a mixture of sautéed Savoy cabbage, onion, raisins and pine nuts and topped with sesame seeds. Recipe from my book: Mediterranean Vegetarian Cooking.
Heat 3 or 4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil in a heavy saucepan and add 1 medium finely chopped onion. Cook over a moderate heat until it is softened. Add 1 small shredded Savoy  cabbage, (about 450g (1 lb) and stir well. Cover and cook over a gentle heat for 20 minutes or until the cabbage is tender, stirring from time to time so it cooks evenly. Add 50g (1/3 cup) lightly toasted pine nuts and 50g (1/3 cup) raisins and season with salt and black pepper. Set aside to cool.
Cover the work surface or table with a clean cloth. Lay 1  large fresh or thawed sheet of filo pastry over the cloth and brush lightly with olive oil. Repeat with 2 more sheets of filo pastry. Spoon the cabbage mixture over the third of the pastry closest to you and roll over once, then brush the top lightly with olive oil. Carefully pick up the corners of the cloth closest to you and roll over once. Brush the top lightly with olive oil, then lift the cloth again and roll the strudel over completely. Brush the top lightly with olive oil. Pick up the cloth and the strudel and very carefully twist into a well greased baking sheet. Brush the top with olive oil and sprinkle with 2 or 3 tablespoons sesame seeds. Bake in a preheated 180C/350F oven for 25 minutes or until the top is crisp and golden. Serve hot. Serves 4. @thegfw
#cabbage #balkanfood #strudel #veganrecipes #mediterraneanrecipes  #plantbased #veganuary #eatmoreveggies #youarewhatyoueat
#easyrecipes #eatreal #eatrealfood #meatless #makeitdelicious #art #healthyfood #museum #veganeats #artandfood #vegetarianrecipes  #stilllife #stilllifepainting 
#eatplants #18thcenturyart

Still life with fruit bowl, flowers and onions. Susan Valadon. c.1919.
Kanda bhajis are crisp onion fritters made with a besan or chickpea flour and spices- usually fresh ginger, ground coriander, turmeric, chilli and garlic. Bhajis should not be confused with pakoras. Onion bhajis are made with sliced onions mixed with chickpea flour and spices, while onion pakoras are made with a batter of chickpea flour, water and spices.
Slice 2 or 3 medium onions thinly and place in a mixing bowl. Sprinkle lightly with salt and set aside for 10 to 15 minutes. Add 2 tablespoons finely chopped coriander, 1 hot green chilli pepper, that has been de-seeded and finely chopped, 1 teaspoon finely grated fresh ginger, 1 or 2 crushed garlic cloves, 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander, 1/2 teaspoon garam masala and 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric and mix well. Lastly add 50grams (1/2 cup) chickpea flour and toss well so all the onions are coated with flour.
Drop tablespoons of the mixture into hot oil and cook, in batches, until they are crisp and golden on both sides. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on a paper towel. Serve hot. Serves 4.  @thegfw
#foodtalkindia #indianfood #onions #onion #vegetarianrecipes #meatfreemonday #veganuary #veganrecipes #vegan  #foodindia #fritters #indianfood #indiancuisine #indianstreetfood #museum #indianrecipes #plantbased #susanvaladon #stilllife #art #postimpressionism #stillife #artandfood #foodandart #veggies #veggielover #veg #veganeats #plantpower #eatplants

Still life with fruit and vegetables. Vincent Van Gogh 1884. Vincent Van Gogh Museum, Amsterdam.
This simple North Indian dish consists of stir-fried cabbage and tomatoes spiced with cumin, ground coriander, turmeric, fresh ginger, garlic and chilli. It is usually served with rice pilau, dhal (spices lentils) and perhaps some yoghurt on the side.
Trim the ends of 1 small green cabbage (about 500g) and slice it fairly thinly.
Heat 2 tablespoons ghee or coconut oil in a heavy saucepan and add 1 medium finely chopped onion, 2 small red chilli peppers, de-seeded and finely chopped, 2 or 3 finely chopped garlic cloves and 1 tablespoon finely grated ginger and cook over a moderate heat until the onion starts to turn golden. Add 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 teaspoon ground coriander and 1/2 teaspoon  ground turmeric and cook for 30 seconds. Add the cabbage, stir well and cook over a gentle heat for 7 or 8 minutes, stirring from time to time so it cooks evenly. Add 2 canned plum tomatoes, that have been forced through a sieve or puréed in a blender and continue to cook for for 5 more minutes or until the cabbage is tender but still has a crunch. Serve hot. Serves 4. 
#cabbage #indianfood #tasteofindia #flavoursofindia #vegan #plantbased veganfood #vegansofinstagram #veganlifestyle #veggies #vegatrainarecipes eatyourgreens #impressionism #easyrecipes #vincentvangogh #vincentvangoghmuseum #veganuary  #artist #masterpeice #curry #vegetables #artandfood #veganideas #tryvegan #foodandart #artandfood #stillife #stilllife #stilllifepainting #frenchpainting #veggielove #vegansofig #veganrecipes

MUSHROOMS: The Art, Design and Future of Fungi. 
Image by Seana Gavin @seanagavin
A new exhibition will be open to the public at Somerset House from 31 Jan - 26 April curated by Francesca Gavin. @roughversion 
Francesca Gavin has also written a piece on Mushrooms for The Gourmand magazine (Issue 13) that includes a couple of my recipes.
#mushrooms #somersethouse #mycelium #cake #fungus #thegourmand #mushroom #theartofmushrooms #wildmushrooms

The silver goblet. Jean-Baptiste-Simeon Chardin. 1731. The Louvre. Paris.
This simple apple and raisin cake is perfect for teatime or for breakfast. It can be served warm or cold , as you like.
Peel, core and quarter 800g (1 3/4 lbs) cooking apples and slice them fairly thinly. Sprinkle with 50 grams (1/3 cup) raisins that have been soaked in hot water for 15 minutes and drained and the rind and juice of 1/2 lemon.
Mix  100g (1/2 cup) sunflower seed oil with 100g (1/2 cup) castor sugar . Add 3 beaten eggs and 1/2 cup milk and blend well. Stir in 85g (2/3 cup) wholemeal or unbleached white flour mixed with 1 teaspoon baking powder. Lastly fold in the apple mixture. Pour into a well-buttered 23/24 cm (9/10in) springform cake tin that has been buttered and dusted with flour and bake in a preheated 180C/350F oven for I hour or until the top is golden  and a knife comes out clean from the centre. Remove from the oven, unclip the pan and set aside to cool. 
Serves 8 to 10. @thegfw 
#apples #applecake #cake #cakes #teatime  #caketime #cakegram #chardin #museums #museum #artist #baroque #art #roccoco #painting #museedulouvre #thegfw #cakeoftheweek #stilllife #stillife #18thcenturyart #cakelove #stilllifepainting ##foodandart #homecooking #sweetooth #sweettooth #masterpeice #artandfood

Still life with vegetables. Zenaida Serebriakova. 1936z
Throughout the mountain regions of northern Italy from Lake Como to Friuli they make a variety of 'casoncelli' (half-mooned shaped ravioli) that are called 'carunsei' in Bergamo, 'ciaroncie' in Trentino, 'casunziei' in Cortina d'Ampezzo and 'cialzons' in Friuli. The name derives from the Latin word 'caseus' meaning ''cheese.' - which is the ingredient that they all have in common. In Cortina 'cazunziei' were originally made with beetroots and yellow turnips, but today yellow turnips are very hard to find, so potatoes or ricotta are often used instead. It is said that every family in the region has their own recipe - a closely guarded secret that has been passed down from mother to daughter for generations.
Prepare the pasta dough as usual with 300g (about 2 1/2 cups) unbleached flour, 3 eggs and a pinch of salt. Knead for 8 to 10 minutes or until the dough is smooth and elastic. Wrap the dough in a damp cloth and set aside to rest for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile peel 450g(1 lb) beetroots and cut in quarters . Steam for 20 minutes or until tender.
Force through a sieve or mash with a potato ricer. Add 1 egg, 125g (1/2 cup) well drained ricotta, 2 or 3 tablespoons freshly grated grams padana or Parmesan cheese and season with a grating of nutmeg, salt and black pepper. If the mixture is too wet you can  1 or 2 tablespoons of dry breadcrumbs.
Roll the dough out very thinly and cut into rounds about 5cm (2 ins) in diameter. Spoon a little filling onto the centre of each circle and fold over to make a half moon shape, pressing firmly around the edges to seal in the filling.
Cook in plenty of lightly salted boiling water for 5 minutes or until they are tender. Remove with a slotted spoon and transfer to a heated serving dish. Pour over about 100g (3 1/2 oz) melted butter and 2 tablespoons poppy seeds. Serve at once with freshly grated grana padana on the side. Serves 4. @thegfw
#pasta #pastapasta #instapasta #ravioli #russianart  #primipiatti #beets #beetroot #ricotta  #primi #painting #pastamania #cookitalian #paintings #italianfood #cortinadampezzo #art #expressionism #thegfw #pastaaddict #pastaporn

Still life with balsam apples and vegetables. James Peale. c. 1820's. Metropolitan Museum of Art. New York.
A thoran is a simple South Indian dish of shredded. or grated vegetables - usually cabbage, carrots, green beans or spinach - that is cooked in coconut oil with shallots, chillies, grated coconut and spices. It is usually served with a rice pilau or chapatti on the side.
Trim the ends of 1/2 green or white cabbage (about 500g/1 lb) and shred it finely.
Heat 2 tablespoons coconut oil in a large frying pan and add 1 teaspoon black mustard seeds. Cook over a moderate heat until they start to sputter. Add 4 or 5 finely chopped shallots and continue to cook for 2 or 3 minutes or until they are translucent. Add 1 or 2 green chillies, that have been de-seeded and finely chopped and 5 or 6 curry leaves and cook over a gentle heat for 1 more minute. Add 1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric and the cabbage and stir well. Cover and cook over a gentle heat for 10 minutes or until the cabbage is tender, stirring from time to time so it cooks evenly. If the cabbage starts to stick you can add 1 or 2 tablespoons water. Add 6 tablespoons fresh or frozen grated coconut, season with salt and simmer for a few more minutes. Serves 4. @thegfw
#cabbage #vegetables #veggies #vegetable #thoran #eathealthy  #indianfood #southindianfood #southindiancuisine #veggielover #vegan #indianrecipes #realism #eatyourgreens #artist #plantbased #plantpower #veggielovers #stillife #veganrecipes #stilllife #stillifepainting #museum #stilllifepainting #veganeats #easyrecipes #jamespeale #thegfw #eatmoreplants #metropolitanmuseumofart

Still life with vegetables. Zenaida Serebriakova. 1936.
Zelenica or zeljanica is one of Bosnia's most famous dishes and is enjoyed by Muslims, christians and Jews alike. It is made with filo pastry, filled with a mixture of wild spinach or Swiss chard or wild greens, cottage cheese, kajmak - kind of clotted cream and grated cheese, that is baked in the oven until the top is crisp and golden. traditionally it is served by Bosnian Jews for the Sabbath.
Wash 500g (1 lb) spinach and cook in a covered saucepan for 5 to 7 minutes or until tender. The water clinging to the leaves is sufficient to prevent scorching. Drain well and chop coarsely.
Place 250 grams well drained cottage cheese or ricotta, 50 grams freshly grated Livno  or Parmesan cheese, 4 tablespoons clotted or sour cream and 2 large eggs in a bowl and mix well. Add the spinach, 1/2 teaspoon ground Ceylon cinnamon and a grating of nutmeg and season with salt and black pepper.
Arrange a sheet of fresh or thawed filo pastry over the bottom and sides of a well-oiled 23cm (9in) spring form cake tin and brush lightly with olive oil or ghee. Repeat with 2 more sheets of filo pastry. Pour in the filling and fold over any overlapping sheets of filo pastry. Cover with another sheet of filo pastry and brush lightly with olive oil. Repeat with 4 or 5 more sheets of filo pastry, tucking in the ends.  Sprinkle 3 tablespoons sesame seeds over the top. Bake in a preheated 190C / 375 F oven for 40 to 45 minutes or until the top is crisp and golden. Serve hot. Serves 4.
#greenvegetables #greens #greenveggies #eatgreen #eatyourcolours #greenfood #meatfree #eatyourveggies #meatfreemonday #eattherainbow #veggielife #eatmoreplants #bosnia #balkanfood #eattherainbow #meatfreemonday #art #meatlessmeals #stillife #veggierecipes #stilllife #vegetarianmeals #vegtarianrecipes #stilllifepainting #artist #expressionism #fitfood #artandfood #foodandart #eatmoreplants #eatfit

Pates alimentaires. 1920's advertisement for pasta.
Busiati al pesto trapanese ( macaroni with pesto Trapanese) is one of western Sicily's most famous dishes. Pesto was first introduced to the port of Trapani, but sailors from Genoa, but gradually it was modified to include almonds and tomatoes. Traditionally the sauce is made in a mortar with a pestle, but if you are in a hurry it can also be made in a food processor. The proportions can vary from cook to cook. Sometimes it is made with raw tomatoes , sometimes it is made with a little cooked tomato sauce.
To make the pesto, place 40grams (1/3 cup) lightly toasted blanched almonds in a  mortar and crush with a pestle. Add 2 or 3 garlic cloves, 25 gram (1 oz) fresh basil and continue to crush with a pestle until the mixture forms a thick paste. Add 2 ripe plum tomatoes that that have been peeled,  seeded and chopped and 50 grams (1/2 cup) freshly grated pecorino or parmesan cheese and continue to grind, making sure that the tomatoes  remain a little chunky. Transfer to a bowl and add just enough extra  virgin olive oil (about 6 to 8 tablespoons) to make a creamy sauce, then season with salt and black pepper.
Cook 400 grams bucatini in plenty of lightly salted boiling water until they are tender, but still firm Drain well and transfer to a heated serving dish. Pour over the pesto, toss lightly, and serve at once.
Serves 4.

Bunch of garlic and a tin pot. Jacob Meyer de Haan  c. 1889. Rjiksmuseum, Amsterdam.
L'aillade is a garlic soup from  Languedoc that in the past was served to newly weds on their wedding night. It is made with a whole head of garlic simmered in water with a bay leaf and a pinch of thyme, thickened with a mixture of eggs yolks and olive oil and served over slices of toast.
Bring 1 litre ( 4 1/2 cups) water to the boil and add 8 to 10 crushed garlic cloves. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes, then remove from the heat.
Meanwhile beat 4 egg yolks with a few drops of vinegar. With a wire whisk, very slowly beat in 4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, drop by drop, as for mayonnaise. Gradually add a ladleful of hot soup, then pour the mixture back into the soup. Heat through, but do not boil or the soup will curdle. Season with salt and plenty of black pepper.
Place 4 slices of lightly toasted country bread in 4 individual soup bowls and pour over the hot soup. Serve at once. Serves 4.

Cauliflower and pomegranates. Pierre-Augusta Renoir. 1890.
This Sephardic recipe from Algeria is made with steamed cauliflower florets, simmered in a delicious onion and tomato sauce flavoured with cumin and harissa. Recipe from my book: Jewish Vegetarian Cooking.
Trim the stalk off 1 medium cauliflower, then break into florets. Steam for 5 to 6 minutes or until just tender.
Heat 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil in a large frying pan and add 2 medium chopped onions. Cook over a moderate heat until they are softened. Add 4 ripe tomatoes that have been peeled, seeded and chopped, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 - 2 teaspoons harissa, to taste and season with salt. Cook for a further 8 to 10 minutes or until the sauce starts to thicken, then add the cauliflower florets. Simmer for a few more minutes to blend the flavours. Serve hot. 
Serves 4 to 6. @thegfw

Still life with paw paw. Freida Lock. (1902-1962).
The papaya originally comes from Mexico, Central America and northern South America, but today it is grown through the tropical and sub- tropical world . It is usually eaten raw, but unripe green papayas are often cooked and appear in a variety of dishes especially in the Philippines, Thailand and Indonesia. The black seeds of the papaya have a spicy taste and, when dried, can be ground and used as an alternative to black pepper.
This simple salad consists of papaya, avocado and lamb's lettuce with an olive oil and lime dressing. 
Wash 50 g lamb's lettuce, pat it dry and arrange in 4 individual salad bowls. Cut 2 avocados  in half, remove the stones and dice the flesh. Arrange over the lamb's lettuce.
Peel 2 papayas, cut in half and scoop out the seeds. Cut into dice and place over the avocado.
Make a dressing with 3 or 4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, the juice of 1/2 lime, 1/2 teaspoon sugar and a pinch of cayenne pepper. Pour a little dressing over each of the salads and toss lightly. Serves 4.

From an Italian Art Deco Happy New Year postcard.
Happy New Year, everyone !

Mushrooms . William Nicholson. 1940. Tate Britain, London.
From 31 January to 29 April 2020 there will an exhibition at Somerset House called Mushrooms: The Art, Design and Future of Mushrooms - curated by my eldest daughter, Francesca Gavin @roughversion that includes several artworks by my youngest daughter, the collage artist @seanagavin. I do hope you will go and see it if you can.
Today's recipe is a simple potato and mushroom gratin from the Murge in Puglia made with  layers of potatoes, wild mushrooms, garlic, parsley, breadcrumbs and grated cheese. In Puglia it is usually made with 'funghi cardoncelli' - king oyster mushrooms that are prized for their pleasing taste and aroma and because they do not change consistency when cooked, but if they are unavailable any quality mushroom can be used instead.
Cook 500g (1 lb) potatoes in lightly salted boiling water for 10 to 12 minutes  or until half cooked. Drain and peel, when they are cool enough to handle, then slice fairly thinly.
Brush away any soil from 350g (3/4 lb) mushrooms, wipe with a damp cloth and slices fairly thickly.
Arrange a layer of potatoes in the bottom of a well-oiled shallow baking dish,cover with a layer of mushrooms and season with salt and black pepper. Sprinkle with 2 or 3 tablespoons finely chopped flat leaf parsley mixed with 1 finely chopped garlic clove, 2 tablespoons soft breadcrumbs and 1 or 2 tablespoons finely grated pecorino or parmesan cheese, then drizzle over a little extra virgin olive oil. Repeat the layers until the potatoes and mushrooms are used up ending with a layer of breadcrumbs and grated cheese. Drizzle a little extra virgin olive oil over the top , then pour in 60ml (1/4 cup) hot water. Bake in a preheated 190C/365 F oven for 45 minutes or until the potatoes and mushrooms are tender, the liquid is evaporated and the top is golden. Serve hot. Serves 4. @thegfw
